question: Which are the two parties involved in the international treaty "Concordat of 1854"?
explanation: The Concordat of 1854 was an international treaty between the president of the Republic of Guatemala - General Captain Rafael Carrera - and the Holy See (Holy See is the jurisdiction of the Bishop of Rome, known as the pope), which was signed in 1852 and ratified by both parties in 1854. Through this treaty, Guatemala gave the education of the Guatemalan people to the regular orders of the Catholic Church, committed to respecting the ecclesiastical properties and monasteries, authorized mandatory tithing and allowed the bishops to censor what was published in the country.
